data.enText: to give sth to sb, especially to show how much they are respected

data.chText: 那是国王赐给他的头衔。
data.enText: It was a title bestowed upon him by the king.

ex.chText: 牛津大学授予他博士头衔。
ex.enText: Oxford University conferred the title of doctor on him.
The President conferred a metal on her.

synonyms.bx: 尤指作为对所取得成绩的奖励而授予某人学位、荣誉、权利、名号等，常与介词 on/upon 连用。

ex.enText: He was accorded permission to meet the king.
She was accorded a cold welcome.

ex.chText: 我们的社会赋予家庭十分重要的地位。
ex.enText: Our society accords great importance to the family.

synonyms.bx: 指授予某人或某事物权力、地位、某种待遇等。

ex.enText: She was awarded for being the best student.

ex.chText: 她获得了去哈佛大学读书的奖学金。
ex.enText: She has been awarded a scholarship to study at Harvard.
The panel of judges awarded him first prize.

synonyms.bx: 指官方或经正式研究决定后对成绩突出者或竞赛优胜者给予奖励、奖金等。

ex.enText: The trophy is bestowed on the winner.

ex.chText: 该国给这位民族英雄颁发了国家最高奖章。
ex.enText: The country bestowed its highest medal upon the national hero.

synonyms.bx: 指授予某人具有重大价值或意义的东西，尤用于表示尊重，常和介词 on/upon 连用。

example: The university conferred a degree on its most famous former student, who never graduated
Her presence lends a certain cachet to the company
The music added a lot to the play
She brings a special atmosphere to our meetings
This adds a light note to the program

value.def: To bestow something on someone means to give or present it to them.

example.ex: The Queen has bestowed a knighthood on him.
example.tran: 女王已经授予他爵士头衔。
